website_summaries.verdict: A popular, sleek, and strong magnetic bar that mounts to any kitchen surface.
pros: With a magnetized back, it can be affixed to a fridge or mounted to a wall, backsplash, or cabinet door
cons: The magnetic surface measures only 15 3/4 inches
While lighter knives and gadgets are easily supported, heavier knives may slip

customer_reviews.title: I want another one!
customer_reviews.text: I want order another one!!! I wish I had thought purchase one of these sooner. The magnet is strong and holds plenty of my everyday knives. I decided to put on the side of my fridge and it hold perfectly when you remove the back and stick directly on. I didn't need anything extra to hold it in place either. I'd like to get one more for the rest of tools because this so much better than the block! Now I have more counter space.
customer_reviews.author: RayJoni07

customer_reviews.title: fall if with even the slightest bump and if you need to have the knife held at an angle due to space constraints like I did you can forget it
customer_reviews.text: The magnet on this product is far too weak to hold the knives in place and they tend to slide down, fall if with even the slightest bump and if you need to have the knife held at an angle due to space constraints like I did you can forget it. The magnet needs to be about 4X stronger for this product to be of any use at all. Trying to find a use for it in the tool shed or workbench but same problem. Tried to return it but I was out of town and missed the cutoff date. I recommend you go to a local kitchen store and try before you buy. I got burned.
customer_reviews.author: Rotten

customer_reviews.title: My knives are sliding down the bar
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a knife block that took up a lot of valuable counter space. I installed this earlier today & put my knives on the bar. As the day has progressed, my knives are slowly sliding down the bar toward the countertop. Hopefully they stop sliding at some point so I will know where to place them in the future, but as it stands, I’m a little concerned about my knife edges if this is going to happen every time. Right now, I’m hopeful. If it happens that my knives continue to slide or actually slide off, the score will definitely drop. As an aside, it was easy to install & looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle C

customer_reviews.title: I cannot imagine a better product of this kind!
customer_reviews.text: This is one terrific magnetic rack! It is beautiful and works superbly. I mounted this very simply by removing the the mounting strip, then allowing the rack to attach magnetically to the side of my refrigerator. This left it a bit too free to slide in the plane of the refrigerator, so I added several pieces of industrial-strength double sticky tape. The result was very stable and able to support a great many knives, some of them hefty. So I ordered a second magnetic strip.
customer_reviews.author: Philip C.

customer_reviews.title: There's better
customer_reviews.text: Chef here, I've bought a lot of knife magnets for the shop and home. These, not so great. Look nice, but, not much holding power. Will not hold a Cuisinart can opener...for example...or a thin bladed knife with heavy handle...it will spin. Best are the models with 2 ceramic maget strips sandwiched between steel set in wood. Bought these on sale... mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Chef BB

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for fridge mounting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have other Modern Innovations products and like their quality. I got this item specifically because the description says it can mount in the fridge. NOT True! I placed it in the fridge after removing the wall mounting plate. I added the knives ( only 6, 4 of which were small). Not even a few minutes later I was taking a knife off and the whole bar slipped down. Some knives fell off and cut my flooring. I’m just lucky it didn’t cut me. This may work well for wall mounting, but don’t buy it for fridge mounting.
customer_reviews.author: ButtonButterbee

customer_reviews.title: Loved this when I first Put this up but now ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved this when I first Put this up but now 4 weeks later it is starting to rust and that is why I had to replace my other one... Now it is too late to send back for a refund so I am bummed this happened. Looked really nice for a little bit there
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't connect directly to fridge as ad claims.
customer_reviews.text: Somewhere in the ad i read that it can be directly attached to the refrigerator; it was my understanting that the magnetic force would keep it there, without the use of mounting screws or adhesives. Inwas disappointed to discover that is not the case. The magnets are very strong, but the design of it- not having a flat backside- prohibits its magnetic adhesion to the fridge. I don't know if I am describing this correctly, but Ibam disappointed and I wish I had not been led to believe I could slap this on the fridge and have it held there by magnetic force alone and also work in the front to hold metal items.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer Who Shall Remain Nameless

customer_reviews.title: Sold
customer_reviews.text: I'm so tickled... Ok, so I just opened and installed the knife magnet onto my refrigerator within 2 minutes... it was very easy to pull the backing off, not hard at all, if you do as the instructions say... This is a very sleek item, strong magnet. Received on time and I plan to keep adding knives to my collection. So yes, I'll be purchasing another...
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small kitchens
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about how to store my knives and big metal utensils when I moved to a smaller apartment, this has been an excellent solution. I used four or five 3M command strips to mount is above my oven range when I fist moved in and it hasn't budged or loosened in the six months it's been up. The magnet hold my largest kitchen knives securely but the magnet isn't so strong as to make them hard to remove. Being above my range it hasn't shown any staining or splatter from my cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: A kitchen winner!!
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, does a great job keeping my knives handy! Because I have a tile backsplash and didn't want to try drilling in it, I put it up with heavy-duty mounting tape rather than the recommended mount w/screws, but everything's staying right and tight. I do have one heavy, beveled-edge knife that won't hang straight and seems unstable, and I've not tried hanging anything other than knives on it, but the ones that I particularly wanted to have in easy reach work just fine. I love the size of it, as well as the neat, clean appearance.
customer_reviews.author: zgmcgee

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold much, weight-wise.
customer_reviews.text: This is not a good product in my experience. It holds kitchen knives fine, but as far as things its advertised to hold such as pliers, hammers, etc. -- forget it, they slide right off. The larger knives are also held at an angle because its not strong enough to fully hold them upright. I don't know if I got a bad one but I'm hesitant to order another one. Maybe you get what you pay for? This is going back and I'll buy from another company.
customer_reviews.author: Verve T.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Like most things that come out of China this is yet another product the manufacturer felt necessary to cut corners on and save like I dunno, 2 bucks a unit and just not put anywhere near enough magnets to hold anything outside of small steak knifes. When I put my regular stainless steel knifes on this it just falls off the fridge and leaves a nice deep gash on its way down too. I had to purchase additional neodymium magnets to this so I can actually use it. To the manufacturers; we'd pay more money if you'd actually make the products quality. Hopefully this review will save someone a headache.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bob McGraw

customer_reviews.title: Works well to free up counterspace
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers did, I attached to side of refrigerator. The magnet feels strong enough to hold in place with no slipping. It does make a big difference in the amount of countertop being used up for those of us with small spaces. My only complaint is that the side where the knives attach does not seem to have as much magnetic force as the back side. Probably due to the metal which wraps around the front for aesthetic purposes? It does look good. However, my bread knife was too heavy (or maybe because it's slim and not much metal contact for the weight?) and the darned thing slid right off.
customer_reviews.author: MoMom

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: This is a lovely knife magnet and looks polished on the wall. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is that the plastic anchor/molly that comes with the screws are cheap and bent when I tried to hammer it into the wall. I picked up different anchors at the hardware store that have threads, which screw easily into the wall. I originally thought 16" might be too long but you need space between knives. I have 5 on mine and its perfect. I know some mentioned using two-sided tape or command strips for the install, but it's heavy and the directions clearly state to use the enclosed for installation.
customer_reviews.author: Lori7

customer_reviews.title: This is the Knife Bar You’ve Been Looking For!
customer_reviews.text: First: orig order arrived damaged due to package traveling up/down east coast. Processed an exchange and had a replacement w/in 2 days. Remove the back plate (watch your fingers ‘cuz it will get caught due to strength of magnet) and attached to fridge. Absolutely thrilled we didn’t have to drill into our backsplash. Provided 3 pics for your viewing to see product up close, from a distance, and next to cabinet showing enough room for door to swing open. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: GMD of Yorkshire, UK

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Review
customer_reviews.text: Likes: Beautiful and mounted very easily. Dislikes: Scratches and scuffs very, very, easily for stainless steel. (Note: I taped clear tape to protect the finish from further scratching) Photos depicting large knives, pliers, paint brushes etc. COULD be a bit misleading because my knives and pliers of those sizes are either heavier, or a different ferrous material, because they quickly slide off - very dangerous. (Note: I have purchased many similar bars in local hardware stores that easily hold the weight of small hammers, chisels, and pliers.) I ended using the bar to hold small items like nails, screws and small scissors.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: not so easy to mount using heavy duty tape
customer_reviews.text: i used heavy duty 3M velcro strips to mount it against my tile backsplash. after a couple days, the bar detached and came tumbling down. the cause is that you're not able to apply enough velcro because there are only two contact points on the mounting plate that come in contact with the mounting surface (one of them pictured). this isn't clear or described in the manufacturer's pictures and instructions. i ended up having to drill it into a different surface at a less optimal location.
customer_reviews.author: D.K.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I had previously purchased a magnetic knife holder from amazon, when I owned a home and was able to screw it into the wall. I recently moved out of state and into an apartment where the landlord isn't big on holes in the walls, Found this magnetic knife holder and read the reviews which mentioned that you needed to remove the back plate so it will stay on the frig. I took a chance and I was not disappointed. Love it and will probably be purchasing more to hold metal measuring cups/spoons since my kitchen is small.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Koontz

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this knife rack. It uses multiple magnets which results in a non-uniform magnetic field. This causes items to twist around. Because the field is weaker where the magnetic field is weak, the entire bar can't be used because items will fall off. The magnetic field strength is inadequate to hold even standard items. The idea is good, but the design is really bad. The only reason I didn't give it one star is because it looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Epstein

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Installed with mounting tape!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed for my work space. Since I wanted to install to a concrete wall, I opted to use Chameleon mounting tape (also purchased on amazon). Screws are provided, mounting tape is sold separate. I’m able to organize my tools and have them easily accessible. I’ll be getting several more as I have more tools I’d like to “hang.” Very easy install (photos for reference)
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but works wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a block of knives, but since moving into a smaller place, I needed something that would keep precious counter space free. I love this! It came with screws, but I used a heavy-duty double-sided tape (I bought on amazon and have posted a review) and it held up very well despite being pretty heavy. I was surprised by the weight of the magnet, to be honest, so be prepared for that. It is very strong so it has no problems holding my chef knives, steak knives and other utensils. It also has a lovely sleek design, so I appreciated that. I would buy it again or recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Ceej

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but doesn't hold knives.
customer_reviews.text: This product looked promising but it does not hold my knives securely and I do not recommend it. When I put a knife on the magnet the knife immediately rotates, and even a lightweight santoku knife will not stay oriented vertically. A bigger chef's knife ends up hanging at a 30 degree angle. Maybe I'll take it to the workshop to hold small parts or tooling, but its useless in my kitchen and is probably going back to amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Moran

customer_reviews.title: Super strong magnets-Holds my knives tightly
customer_reviews.text: This is great for my knives! I first mounted it with some extra strong Command stips but it only held for a few weeks and scared the crap out of us when it fell. My husband then mounted it with the screws that were included. BE CAREFUL, it is a VERY STRONG magnet! My husband got his thumb caught when trying to seperate it to remount and it snapped on it and made a pretty deep pinch/cut. His comment on having the knives out was "oh great, nothing like leaving murder weapons out for intruders to easily find" but I like the convenience so worth the risk!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love the knife bar. It was absolutely simple to install. If installing in sheetrock, they include two plastic anchors (I think that's what they are called) with the screws. I installed mine in sheetrock and it took me literally about 5 minutes. The bar is so sturdy and I have 6 knives, a set of measuring spoons, and a meat thermometer on mine. I ordered this because one of my drawers broke because it was so heavy so I have to reduce the weight. This not only helped in that regard, but it also looks cool on the wall. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: earthgarden

customer_reviews.title: I really like this!
customer_reviews.text: I really like what I see so far although I haven't attached it to the wall yet. The magnet is intensely strong, all kinds of tools and gadgets were held nicely and aren't going to slide or fall off. They were also easy to lift off! I like the brushed surface because it doesn't show fingerprints or light surface scratches that could occur over time. It's very sleek and unobtrusive appearing which is a plus. Overall, I think anyone would definitely enjoy using this. I'll rate it differently later on if there are any changes, but I highly doubt there would be.
customer_reviews.author: J-Z

customer_reviews.title: I returned these
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these and the magnet is so strong my finger got smashed between them. Also it doesn’t work well with ceramic knives. They are very sleek looking though, but they were also too long for the space between the outlets on my backsplash. If you buy these, measure the space first to be sure you are not hanging knives over outlets..
customer_reviews.author: Mary A.

customer_reviews.title: Weak. Doesn't hold knives.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a magnetic knife strip for my knives and various other kitchen tools. This one doesn't fit the bill. It was easy to install, but failed to hold any of my knives or kitchen utensils. They just slid right off. If I very carefully placed them and very carefully let them go, they would stay put only until the slightest provocation, at which point they'd just slide right off in a dangerous and loud clatter of sharp steel. Pretty disappointing. I recommend spending more money on a stronger magnetic knife strip.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Castro

customer_reviews.title: Works well, looks good, cheap anchors included
customer_reviews.text: This thing is worth buying. It has a strong enough magnet for most knifes. I have one skinny bread knife slides right off it but I rarely use that knife and it can sit in a block elsewhere. It looks nice and does it's job. For the life of me I can't understand why they included terrible anchors. Most people are going to have to use drywall anchors to position this where they want. They included the worst soft anchors that literally just fold in half with even the most gently push. I luckily had some lying around that were the same size but not total junk.
customer_reviews.author: D. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Magnet not Strong enough
customer_reviews.text: Combination of the magnets not being strong enough and the brushed finished being glass smooth without having any texture results in my knives not staying in place. The knives slide right off, from paring knife to chef knife. My knives are Wusthof Culinar and on the heavier side as they don't have wood or plastic handles. They stayed in place on my Wusthof magnet much better, but I was looking for something longer for knives that I added to the set, so I tried this out. The finish also scratches pretty easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Uneven Magnetism
customer_reviews.text: Everything works great except that it has a lot of places that are not as strongly magnetized. I feel like they economized by spacing the magnets out. The result is that things want to move sideways instead of sticking where you put them. See the video. UPDATE: I strongly recommend the competitive product from RSVP Endurance. It’s SO MUCH better than this one. I left a review on that one with more details as to why.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Smith

customer_reviews.title: Decent but wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: Mounts easily, good solid magnet to hold the unit together and your knives. I find it a little too slippery compared to 'knife bars' like the Ouddy 22 Inch Magnetic Knife Bar, Magnetic Knife Storage Strip, Magnetic Kitchen Knife Holder, Knife Rack Strip. I'd pick that next time - the knives just seem to have better purchase. This one does the job, you just have to pay attention while you're putting a knife on it. If you put it on too low it could easily slip off.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Listener

customer_reviews.title: Strong Magnet Saves Kitchen Space
customer_reviews.text: We have limited kitchen counter space so I ordered this to go under the top cabinets, out of sight but accessible. My husband disagreed because he didn't want to drill holes, so we simply stuck it to the side of the refrigerator. It's been there for over a year and we haven't had any problems. We did position the heaviest, longest, sharpest knife (a J.A. Henckels chef's knife) in the middle with its handle resting on the counter just in case. We highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Go2net

customer_reviews.title: Modern Innovations as a magnetic bar that is remarkable in its strength
customer_reviews.text: After experimenting with multiple magnetic strips, I have discovered Modern Innovations as a product that stands alone in the choices available. Many magnetic strips are barely able to support the weight of a large screwdriver. However, the strip from Modern Innovations can fully support a full sized 18" pipe wrench and other equally heavy tools such as full sized hammers. Modern Innovations is the last magnetic strip you will ever need.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lynskey

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Where do I even begin? I used the heavy duty double stick tape to avoid drilling holes into the tile. As you can see from the photo it didn’t hold longer than a week. However, when it was on the wall, for that short time, the knives were never straight. They were either sliding to the left or the right. The magnet has a mind of it’s own, pulling your knives in a crooked display. I could over look that fact if it stayed mounted, not sure if holes in the tile is worth the product itself. Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.author: shannon

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t use the small screws that came with the unit , I used drywall anchors on one side and a drywall screw on a stud. It works great but wish that they would make it an inch bigger that 16 so that it could fit and secure to 2 studs that are supposed to be 16” on center
customer_reviews.author: jeff butler

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your knives up and out of the way
customer_reviews.text: First of all, it was a breeze to install, like ridiculously easy. Second, once you put a knife flat on this thing do you know where it's going...nowhere! The magnet is crazy strong, maybe a little too strong at times as it almost snatches the knife out of my hand when I go to put it on there. Also, it keeps the sharp objects up and away from the kitchen drawers and little hands that like to mess around in them. And last, it makes your kitchen look organized and professional, a great add to any kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Knives slip off
customer_reviews.text: This thing looks pretty sharp. However, the knives slide when hanging it vertically! I am a chef & have worked in kitchens for over 20 years. Any "Decent" knife rail will hold & keeps any knife from slipping when hung at any angle. I bought this for my house, needless to say I'm very disappointed. Due to space constraints I need to hang it vertically, but that has proven to be a major issue. The knives (even light weight one) don't stick!
customer_reviews.author: jiddo

customer_reviews.title: It actually does hold in place on the fridge!
customer_reviews.text: My kitchen had neither counter space for a knife block, nor enough wall space to hang a standard knife strip making concern for my rental's walls a moot point. This product bypassed the wall when I separated out the back component and held the front section near the refrigerator. The attraction was so strong that it nearly jumped out of my hands and adhered to the fridge. Two of these now hang there: one for knives, the other for kitchen shears and metal utensils. This was the only convertible knife strip that I could find, so I hoped it would do the job. So far, it has performed admirably.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Carnevale

customer_reviews.title: Very useful. Installation should not be taken lightly!
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a must have if you are short on storage space. This looks good in a wall and has a pretty good capacity (I have 10 knifes hanging, 3 of which are relatively large). My only issue is that you must screw into the wall. My kitchen (and I’d imagine most) is mostly tile, so installation must be performed with no mistakes. I ended up skewing this into the side of my cabinet meaning I’ll have to touch it up if it comes along with us on a move. If that’s not a big deal for you then this is almost a perfect way to store (and show off) your knives!
customer_reviews.author: Brent Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Very good and looks good
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our old knife holder which was the kind that is wood and has two metal/magnetic strips that you can see from the front. I liked the old one better and wish we had gotten that...but this one if fine. The knives tend to slip sideways more often on this one. I don't think the magnets are as strong on this one but the knives do not fall off! We got it because of the extra length. And it does look sleeker than the old one...
customer_reviews.author: Orcasgracie

customer_reviews.title: Two mounted very nicely over my sink
customer_reviews.text: These are exceptional pieces. Very solid, very attractive. The mounting hardware is no frills, but the finished mount is rock solid, even in just sheetrock with the anchors. Instructions are sparse, but effective. The hold itself is very solid, no play in the knives once they are mounted. Two mounted very nicely over my sink, and after being sure to use a level and measure well, I'm thrilled with the result. Easy to clean too!! Lifts the room up with pro chef feel. No more block!!
customer_reviews.author: Colin Beech

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect addition to my kitchen. I used to keep my knives in a universal knife block and it sucked. They were always falling over because I have some very long knives. This magnetic strip holds all my knives! It has a very strong hold. I was afraid that it would be too heavy in the wall and that it would fall but so far, it's stayed up. It was a cheaper option at a longer length in comparison to some others I looked at.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Sheffield

customer_reviews.title: Magnet isn't strong enough.
customer_reviews.text: This magnet is not as strong as I would expect, and it has difficulty holding even a basic 8" chef's knife securely. The knife completely rotates and would fall off if I did not have a couple of smaller knives on it closeby to hold it steady. It does an "ok" job, but it's nothing to write home about.
customer_reviews.author: fwoom

customer_reviews.title: Knives shift on bar
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning this because of strange behavior of the magnets. The good thing is that the magnets are extremely strong. Maybe stronger than they need to be. The problem is that the bar contains a number of individual magnets. Because of this, some spots on the bar have a stronger pull than other spots. The other effect is that the handles of the knives become attracted to each other. So when you remove a knife, sometimes the other knives rotate and and shift because the handles have such a strong attraction to each other. I found it unusable because of this.
customer_reviews.author: Seward

customer_reviews.title: Weak - These are NOT neodymium magnets
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice looking product that has superior exterior stainless steel treatment. The issue is that the description of the item in the amazon item description is not accurate. it is described as a strong neodymium magnet. When testing the unit I discovered that the strength of the unit is not strong at all and upon inspection it was clear why. This unit is using plain Ferrite magnets.
customer_reviews.author: George E. Bridges II

customer_reviews.title: Many uses, strong magnet.
customer_reviews.text: This didn't work out for my knives due to young kids and second thoughts on my part. I'd rather they use a butter knife so the sharpies are put away. But I do use this for my screwdrivers. They are on the wall in my laundry room and I love not digging around in a tool box for them. I have about ten screwdrivers on it. My son wanted one for his tool shed too. Made a great Christmas gift for him.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Van Gerpen

customer_reviews.title: It is strong enough
customer_reviews.text: I had read reviews on this holder before purchasing. Despite some people stating that it is not strong enough and the knives tend to slide down - it is quite strong. Probably those people used it for heavy knives. My only issue with this holder is probably I should have bought a longer version. In hindsight I found many items in my kitchen to place on the holder. So 22 inches would be much better.
customer_reviews.author: Azamat Mashukov

customer_reviews.title: It Has Made My Kitchen More Functional!
customer_reviews.text: This magnetic strip is WONDERFUL! I have 2 of them stuck to the side of my fridge. Like other reviewers, I simply pulled off the metal backing and stuck these strips to my fridge like regular magnets. I made sure my fingers were not in the way so they wouldn't get pinched. The magnets are strong enough to hold several knives and utensils, but not so strong that things are difficult to remove. I LOVE how easy it is to walk over and grab what I need, then simply place it back on the strip when I'm done. We just wash our knives and put them right back on the strip. These look very sleek and nice as well!
customer_reviews.author: David & Adrienne

customer_reviews.title: Solid magnet, beautiful brushed stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: The magnets are very powerful. I thought I was going to pinch myself on the metal a couple of times! I'd rather something be strong like that though, because it makes it work. It seems of good quality, time will tell with the quality of the stainless steel, though it should be fine either way as long as you never hang wet things (which who in their right mind would do that?). Pretty happy with this purchase. My only quip would be to include a set of shorter screws as well. I was just drilling into something that was 1", bit drywall, so I had to find some shorter screws.
customer_reviews.author: Uriel V.

customer_reviews.title: Strong multipurpose Magnet
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed in the Kitchen to keep my knives handy and right in front of me. So I got a second and use in the bathroom for tweezers, nail clippers, metal nail file and other little metal grooming tools. The magnet is strong with a solid hold. Instillation is easy - 2 screws, and the mounting hardware is completely concealed when you're finished mounting it. I purchased shorter screws than the ones that came with the magnet so that I could do a mount on a cabinet drawer without screwing through the other side
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Knife with heavy handle and thin blade is a problem
customer_reviews.text: Works very well for all my knives except the boning knife which has a heavy handle for good gripping and a thin flexible blade. It slides right off unless I put it on upside down so it can slide down to where the handle starts at which point it stays pretty well. I put all of them on upside down for consistency :-). Sticks very well to the side of the refrigerator without needing any of the mounting hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Horsley

customer_reviews.title: Great knife holder
customer_reviews.text: This is my second magnetic strip knife holder, I couldn't find the same brand I used before so this was a new version for me. The previous magnet was a little stronger and I never worried about the knives falling off, however it was a little bit of a yank to get the knifes off. This holder is nicer looking and the magnet is pretty strong, but still wouldn't want to put any super heavy knifes on it or they may slide down. Just for reference, we use a few Henckels knives (chef and bread) and stay up just fine.
customer_reviews.author: PO

customer_reviews.title: Quality at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a place to keep my knives that was easily accessible and safe. All of the kitchens I have worked in store them on a magnetic strip, so it was my first inclination to install one in my kitchen at home. Our appliances are stainless steel, so it blends right in. The magnet is really strong and it was easy to install. Great craftsmanship at a really reasonable price. Would highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie K.

customer_reviews.title: Be careful...
customer_reviews.text: First, the magnet is pretty strong, there are no warning labels and when I went to remove the plastic lining they put in the entire backing snapped back in to place and on my finger, causing a black and blue finger for about a week. The piece itself is nice enough, I dont really understand why the whole bar isnt a magnet, it just had several magnets throughout it.
customer_reviews.author: J.Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: Elegant, affordable, perfect
customer_reviews.text: This item is everything they tell you in the details. I was a little skeptical at first but the price was worth giving it a try. I have not been left disappointed. Rather I am very impressed and pleased with this item. I purchased the Gorilla tape to mount this to my subway tiles in my kitchen and it holds my collection of knives perfectly. I had thought about getting a butcher block but I prefer this as it frees up counter space.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Palmer

customer_reviews.title: These are NOT neodymium magnets as advertised but it works OK for the price and look nice
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. Each unit contains a bunch of cheaper ceramic magnets. They are definitely NOT neodymium as advertised. Because they designed this with a bunch of cheap magnets, the knives tend to move toward the center of one of the magnets instead of anywhere on the track. I bought them in late 2020 for under $20 each so I am happy for the performance and look for the price I paid. As of the time I bought t
customer_reviews.author: Eric Rabinowitz

customer_reviews.title: Don't slide your knife off the strip!
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box it looked nice. But when I slid a knife off the strip, the strip scratched badly. After several attempts to find a better way to remove the knife from the strip, even lifting the knife off of the strip, I decided it wasn't worth it. I couldn't find the perfect angle to remove or replace a knife without scratching it. I don't want to be concerned about scratching every time I take a knife off or return it to the strip. I don't have that much time to waste! The finish is shiny stainless. Possibly would be better to find a brushed stainless finish.
customer_reviews.author: kandrues53

customer_reviews.title: Nice BUT
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because it can be magnetically attached to the refrigerator. The only spot I could place this magnetic holder is on the textured side of the refrigerator. With the back mounting plate removed I could only place 3 or 4 knives, like the one pictured, before the holder would slid down the refrigerator., I ended up flipping the holder around so the front is connected to the fridge, but that leaves the back open with the magnetic tape showing. the knives, scissors, and whisks now all stay attached but it looks ugly!
customer_reviews.author: Eric D Underhill

customer_reviews.title: Great for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: I just received this yesterday and it's perfect. I live in a super small apartment with no kitchen space. Took this out of the box, took off the wall attachment and stuck this directly to my fridge. The magnet is so strong, it pulls the knife to it and holds firm. I have 2 10"chef knives, one serrated and one cleaver ND still have space for more. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberlee N. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Strong and secure
customer_reviews.text: This knife holder works great! I’m currently renting my apartment so I just slapped it on the side of my fridge instead of mounting it to the wall and it still holds all my knifes very securely. I keep one knife in a thin vinyl sheath and even that one stays put. Like other reviews said, DEFINITELY watch your fingers with this magnet - you do not want to get pinched by this sucker! Overall, it’s a great space saver and you can definitely trust the magnet strength.
customer_reviews.author: Cheney Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Great product, bad directions
customer_reviews.text: WARNING: Read entire review if you are looking for drill size. -- Very good product, but the directions were terrible. I used a 3/16 inch drill after going from my smallest bit up to that. That was the first hole that fit with the plastic anchor, but I would strongly advise anyone in the future to go up a size at least for the drill bit because the anchor was completely warped after hammering it in place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent magnetic knife holder
customer_reviews.text: This magnetic knife holder is excellent for the side of my refrigerator. I didn't attach it with the screws. I just placed it right on the refrigerator. Be aware this is a VERY STRONG MAGNET! Try to place it before you attach it. I love it and use it not only for knives, but scissors, cake tools - Excellent product and space saver. It would also be great in a garage.
customer_reviews.author: Book Ninja

customer_reviews.title: Super strong.
customer_reviews.text: Attached this with heavy duty 3M double sided tape under a kitchen cabinet. Love it! You can’t see the knives and don’t know there even there. Super strong magnet. Even holds heavy kitchen scissors. **update the 3M tape couldn’t support this product with the knives. It fell about a week later. I ended up screwing it into the bottom of the cabinet. Still love it.
customer_reviews.author: KiKi

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: We’re moving to a new house without a lot of counter space so I didn’t want my two bulky knife blocks on the counter. I also didn’t want to drill into our beautiful tile backsplash to mount a knife rack to the wall. I love that this has the option of sticking to the fridge. I was impressed by the weight and the quality when I pulled it out of the box. I tested it out sticking it to the fridge and sticking my heaviest knife to it. It held up great. The magnet is crazy strong. This was definitely a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does what I need
customer_reviews.text: Really thought I could just magnet this thing to the fridge using the magnets that are part of the block, but that did not work so i did double sided tape which also did not last more then a few days. Nest step is to screw it into the fridge. Does hold a good amount, wish the magnets were just a bit stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny5

customer_reviews.title: Strong magnet, good buy
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install, comes with strong magnet for an in-place secure hold. However I am not sure about moving the board once in place, the magnet seems very strong (almost dangerous) to try to unclip the board once you install it. I ended up using a very strong double side tape as a work around. However this is a good problem to have as the strong magnet keeps the sharp knives pretty much locked in.
customer_reviews.author: Rahul

customer_reviews.title: Holding well, so far!
customer_reviews.text: Just installed today. Based on other reviews, I just attached it to the side of my fridge first. Wanted to see how well the knives stayed in place. Took this pic after 5 hours. It’s holding my collection of cutco knives and shears just fine. Be careful when attaching! I pinched my finger because of the strength of the magnet! Ouch! If all holds well, I will move the strip closer to my stove and prep area. Plan on using Velcro strips to attach to my subway tile backsplash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold knives well
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my son because his son kept putting dirty knives in knife block. He says the magnet is not strong enough for the larger knives. I would return but he said he can use for some of his smaller tools that he uses frequently. So if you need something to hold things like a smaller T-square, this is just the thing for you. Otherwise stick with the block.
customer_reviews.author: Oldhide

customer_reviews.title: Super Sleek & Super Happy
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this product! Great price point and sleek look make this the perfect buy for the kitchen. It attached perfectly to the side of my fridge, but I eventually relocated it to our metal peg board used for pot/pan storage. Holds 4 chef's knives, 3 paring knives, 1 five inch utility knife, and a metal spatula for the cast iron. Everything holds well with the pointed ends side down and the heel of the handle acting as a slip guard.
customer_reviews.author: 15083san

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Knife Bar
customer_reviews.text: This knife bar is exactly what I was wanting. I do not have a ton of counter space so wanted to get rid of the butcher block the knives were in but also did not want to store my knives in a drawer. The magnet is very strong. It's on my fridge and right now I have 12 knives on it of various sizes. Likely won't keep this many on knives on there, but that should give you an idea of the capacity it holds. None have fallen off or anything either. I've had it up for a little over a week.
customer_reviews.author: User123

customer_reviews.title: BEST knife holder for kitchen!  Great to get rid of my broom spikes knife counter holder.
customer_reviews.text: I researched these magnetic holders for knives and am so happy that I ordered the right one's ( ordered two) Trust me, you not be disappointed. If screwing into a tile back splash, you will need a drill bit for cement/tile. Use a plug once drilled and it is simple. The company has a plastic piece that you pull out the metal piece that you secure to the wall. once done you simply place the finished bar and done! Love, Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Teri  DeBellis

customer_reviews.title: Great way to use your vertical space!
customer_reviews.text: Great knife holder! Made space in the drawer by using my vertical space! SUPER POWERFUL magnet! The 16" length has plenty of room for your knife set and a couple pairs of scissors, or a spreader, or whatever. I got a second one for pliers and wrenches in my husband's garage...LOVES it too, because he can see what he wants at a glance and it made room in his tool box!
customer_reviews.author: Denise Carrico

customer_reviews.title: really beautiful wall art besides being useful
customer_reviews.text: having remodeled my kitchen, my older knife holder looked old and tired. I was looking for an American made product was tired of throwing hard earned money on cheaply made foreign junk. I am beyond thrilled with this product, it is well made and the stainless steel looks awesome against my new backsplash tile. I have strongly urged my neighbor to purchase one as she is remodeling her kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: luckyduck

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: Knives Slip
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how there are so many high reviews, but I have the same issue as many of the other 1/2 stars. Knives slip off of the magnetic surface. While the magnet is very strong, it appears there needs to be some texturing to increase the friction so they don't just slide. A normal sized bread-knife barely stays on. I have even attempted to increase the grip by adding some sugru strips to it, which helped, but it is not close to as good of a hold as I would expect, need, or have found with other blocks. The appearance is nice and size as well.
customer_reviews.author: Will R.

customer_reviews.title: You can also attach it with Command wall strips!
customer_reviews.text: I noticed that in one of the previous reviews someone attached this bar to their wall with 3M Command strips so I decided to also try it. It works great and without the hassle of drilling or making any holes. I will add that if you didn’t want to stick or drill it to the wall, you can also attach it to the side of your refrigerator as it’s a magnetic. It also fits my complete knife set.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but the maget is a bit weak, considering buying two just to be safe
customer_reviews.text: Love the holder, but it allows several of our knives to slip, which could be very dangerous. Considering buying two to eliminate the sliding issue we are having with several of our larger AND smaller knives.
customer_reviews.author: W.A. Preston III

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: It won't start magnetized to anything on the side is supposed to. The side that is meant for the knives is the only side that sticks to anything, like the fridge. But when we stick that side to the fridge the other side wouldn't hold the knives, way too weak. We ended up having to wall-mount it, whiff is not what we wanted this for.
customer_reviews.author: JKTourle

customer_reviews.title: Would even recommend for rentals!
customer_reviews.text: We live in a small rental apartment so cabinet drawer space is valuable. What's awesome is that this holds on to dear life fr the side of our fridge with its built is magnet... No need to screw anything in!! It still holds up my 3 knives, large heavy kitchen shears and my clunky meat cleaver. Not to mention it adds an esthetic flare to the kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic and Solid
customer_reviews.text: This is sturdy, easy to install, and hold knives for REAL. We had multiple earthquakes and none of our knives fell. I have it mounted on the fridge magnetically, super easy installation and I can move it whenever I want. My only complaint is that I want a bigger one (I actually returned the smaller model because I liked it so much to get this one)
customer_reviews.author: Selkie

customer_reviews.title: Still happy after two months of use!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! It’s such a space saver for a small apartment kitchen. I decided to place it on the side of our fridge to avoid making holes in the wall, and it is as sturdy as if it was drilled into the thing. The magnet is extremely strong. I never worry about my sharp utensils falling off, and the stainless steel has remained very clean and shiny. Would buy again for sure!!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel H

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great! I had bought a different one previously which ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! I had bought a different one previously which arrived missing some of the mounting hardware, so I was never able to use it.. This MI is bigger, nicer-looking, and super easy to install - I just slapped it on the side of my refrigerator. This sure beats fishing around in drawers for stuff or digging knives out of their protective boxes every time you need to use one. Am thinking about getting a couple more. My only nit-pick is that, because it's mounted magnetically (not screwed in) it won't hold my heaviest knives (well, it holds them, but the bar slides down from the weight). Just sayin'...
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Duttle

customer_reviews.title: Great magnetic knife holder!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite things in my kitchen! This piece is so sleek and with knives on it, it looks phenomenal. This is a double feature: have all of your knives in one easy to reach place + it's statement piece in your kitchen. Additionally, having the knives on display, it has freed up space in my drawers for other kitchen utensils. So happy with this purchase, I would totally recommend! Great price and great product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Saving our knives from ruin!
customer_reviews.text: I got these to replace the knife holder with slots for each knife. My mom kept putting the knives in the wrong slots. Rather than let her ruin our good knives we got this. My husband lived so much we bought a second one. We did not use the wall mount, just stuck to the side of our refrigerator. Very powerful magnet, use caution for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: This can hold my whole knife set!
customer_reviews.text: I love this magnetic bar. I have it on the side of my refrigerator and it's been magnificent! I started decluttering and minimizing my kitchen, and found that storing knives this way is excellent. It holds the knives securely, and if I had little ones, since it's up high, I would feel comfortable with it. Very sturdy! Get one!
customer_reviews.author: Malia F

customer_reviews.title: Strong.  Painful but strong.
customer_reviews.text: This is a strong magnet. I took the back off to mount it to the wall and my finger got caught when putting the front on. It ripped the skin off and bruised my finger up. I have no doubt it will hold my knives if it has enough force to do that. On a side note, the box it came in worked as a great impromptu squeegee when applying window film.
customer_reviews.author: Elie

customer_reviews.title: Knives slanted to the side, didnt stay upright
customer_reviews.text: I sooooo wanted to luv this, it was a simple silver design and looked great on my light grey wall, next to my white subway tile BUT, my knives kept tilting to the side. I hung mine vertically and had not even secured to the wall but, right out the box, the magnet grabbed the knife really well but then knife tilted. Im thinking because my knives have a hefty hilt (handle). The look just wasn’t working for me and if the hang slanted, you wont be anle to hang as many knives. Sorry, had to return. Maybe a lighter knife may work.... good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Robbie Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: This is the instructions only
customer_reviews.text: Decent product. It's surprisingly heavy, because of the magnets. Knives adhere to the magnet well and release easily with a slight twist of the handle. The only thing I would recommend is list the size of the drill bit needed to place the wall anchor. I had to start close, but then increase the diameter of the hole until it was the right size for the anchor. Overall, good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TRAVIS ADAMS

customer_reviews.title: Will hold 4 to 5 medium knives. Looks good.
customer_reviews.text: I have used knife holders for last 5 years and they are very convenient . They add a layer of safety because you could cut your fingers trying to pull a knife from a drawer. This device allows you to keep your knives in plain sight and reduces risk of getting accidental cuts. It looks very good as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ravi L

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressed - not a secure holder
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand how this gets high ratings. It will not hold a paring knife securely, let alone a santoku. I stuck it on the side of the fridge magnetically and hung a couple of knives on it. As long as nothing bumped it, they stayed put they didn't feel secure and it didn't take much for the rack itself to slide down the fridge. My knives are too expensive and too sharp for me to trust to this holder and it's going back.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Random

customer_reviews.title: The magnetic knife bar looks beautiful on my refrigerator and saves valuable drawer/counter space while ...
customer_reviews.text: The magnetic knife bar looks beautiful on my refrigerator and saves valuable drawer/counter space while I'm in a small apartment. It has a mounting bracket if you want to mount it on the wall, but it holds up with a full rack of knives without additional support. The photo below is does not include a couple of items I have added since, including kitchen shears and a large chef knife. I followed the included directions on how to remove the backing for mounting, and just stuck the bar on the side of my refrigerator. I'm very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Lux et Umbra

customer_reviews.title: A stronger magnet would be better.
customer_reviews.text: This is very easy to install. The bracket is screwed in and the magnet sticks to the bracket. I had bought something similar from IKEA years ago but left it behind when we moved. I do think the IKEA version has a stronger magnet. We have this installed under a kitchen cabinet and the longer knives (9.5inches) fall more easily and all of them attach to the magnet crookedly, despite attempted repositioning.
customer_reviews.author: jillybean

customer_reviews.title: READ PACKAGE INSTRUCTIONS!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a 4 star only because it is EXTREMELY heavy duty. Read the package instructions carefully on how to remove the magnet from the strip VERY CAREFULLY. I did not read it correctly (obviously) and literally sliced to chunks of skin off of my finger tips. This magnet is very very powerful and will immediately try and snap bag together to the metal bar. So make sure you read the instructions. Other than that installayion was very quick. My husband had it up in our kitchen in 5 minutes. Comes with the tools.
customer_reviews.author: Liz E.

customer_reviews.title: Saves space and keep your knives sharp.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about a year now and couldn't be happier. Saves space and doesn't make knives dull like other knife storage options. It was really easy to install and should hold 7 knives easily. I have a chef's knife, a utility knife, two steak knives, two petty knives and scissors on these and still room for more.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Li

customer_reviews.title: Works well but knives placed vertical may fall
customer_reviews.text: Great design and idea. Knives placed vertically slip. I place it at 45* then the hilts act like a stop. I put it in a place where, if the knives fell there wouldn't be a danger. That being said, given the way I put the knives they have never fallen and I've been using it more than a year. Saves so much space compared to a block. Looks cool too.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value, brilliant product
customer_reviews.text: This product did exactly what it advertised and is worth every penny. I installed it to my stainless backsplash using 3M adhesive strips as one reviewer suggested as I didn’t want to drill into my tile. It worked brilliantly and my knives look fantastic, my counter is now free of the bulky hideous knife block that occupied precious counter space. I would recommend this to anyone considering mounting their knives.
customer_reviews.author: TKJ

customer_reviews.title: Good size and affordable.
customer_reviews.text: Probably not as quality as some wood blocks but it it gets rather the job done for less money. I use it for my less expensive knives and utensils since heavier knives do wiggle a bit. If you’re lazy about a proper install just slap it on the side of your fridge. Much better than those old wood blocks. Cool way to display your tools.
customer_reviews.author: Kam

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Have two of these in our place for all our knives. Strong enough magnet we have to be careful putting the knives up or they jump out of our grasp. We knock into one set of knives all the ice because they are near the dish drain. No knives have ever fallen off. Better than a knife block that dulls the blades and it also frees up counter space.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Vint

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: We have a tiny kitchen. These really help to maximize the space. Bought one, hubby had me buy 2 more. They are great quality, easy to clean and hold a lot of our kitchen tools. Hubby rarely really likes a product 100% but he especially likes so easy to install feature. LOVE EM!
customer_reviews.author: S. Charles

customer_reviews.title: No more knives falling on the floor or being stacked ...
customer_reviews.text: No more knives falling on the floor or being stacked on the counter. Keeps knives safer and sharper. Extremely strong. Had to work at getting the back off to mount it, the magnet is so strong. Wound up using double stick tape instead of the provided screws.The stainless steel cover matches my appliances too!
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Calliham
